newsitem.title: EGYPT: Sudan's Mahdi arrives in Cairo for talks.
newsitem.headline: Sudan's Mahdi arrives in Cairo for talks.

text.p: Ousted Sudanese prime minister Sadeq al-Mahdi arrived in Cairo on Friday for talks with Egyptian officials and exiled Sudanese opposition members.
Mahdi travelled from Eritrea, where he fled two weeks ago from Sudan. Eritrea hosts and encourages the Sudanese opposition.
"I left Sudan to prevent the Sudanese regime from using my presence there as a hostage," he said.
Sudanese President Omar Hassan al-Bashir overthrew Mahdi's democratically elected government in a bloodless coup in 1989.

Mahdi is expected to spend about 10 days in Egypt and also visit other Arab, European and Asian countries as part of a tour which he said was intended to discuss the situation in Sudan and the "needs of the Sudanese people".
Farouq Abu Eissa, spokesman for the opposition umbrella group the National Democratic Alliance, told Reuters on Thursday that Mahdi would have an extended visit in Egypt.
The opposition alliance has started attacking Sudan from its base in Eritrea.
Eissa said Mahdi would meet members of the NDA and Egyptian officials "as part of the NDA's drive to remove the regime in Sudan and establish peace, democracy and the rule of law."
